alert.note: Alert for Boone; Grant; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 12:19PM EST until March 03 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana and Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Ohio and Switzerland. In Northern Kentucky, Boone, Carroll, Gallatin, Grant and Owen. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1218 PM EST, radar and automated rain gages indicated heavy rain over the region. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Carrollton, Williamstown, Walton, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Vevay, Warsaw, Owenton, Florence, Patriot, Pleasant, Glencoe, Fairview, Ghent, Sanders, Corinth, Sparta and Worthville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
